item.title: PlayStation Plus Game Catalog January 2026 Games Revealed
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation Plus Game Catalog and Classic Titles for January 2026 have been revealed, and players have 8 titles to check out this month. 

January 2026’s PlayStation Plus Game Catalog titles were revealed by a reliable insider yesterday, with Resident Evil Village and Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth headlining the collection for this month. Now we have official confirmation from Sony regarding these games. 

PlayStation Plus Game Catalog Titles Will be Available from January 20, 2026 

We have Resident Evil Village arriving this month, the eighth mainline instalment in the series. It is the perfect time to try this out before Resident Evil Requiem, the ninth instalment, which will be released next month on February 27, 2026. Check out the entire list of games added to the PS Plus Game Catalog and Classics Catalog in January 2026 below: 

Game Catalog 

  • Resident Evil Village (PS5 | PS4)
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth (PS5 | PS4)
  • Expeditions: A MudRunner Game (PS5 | PS4)
  • A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead (PS5 | PS4)
  • Darkest Dungeon 2 (PS5 | PS4)
  • The Exit 8 (PS5 | PS4)
  • Art of Rally (PS5 | PS4)
  • A Little to the Left (PS5 | PS4)

Classics Catalog 

  • Ridge Racer

PlayStation Plus Game Catalog titles are available for Extra members, whereas the Classics Catalog games are reserved for the top-tier, Premium/Deluxe. PlayStation Plus Essential members only get access to a select few games each month, whereas other tiers can check out games from entire libraries.

In other news, PlayStation 2’s CPU was “so overpowered” that it caused military concerns. Additionally, check out the new Hyperpop collection of DualSense controllers and PS5 console covers. What are your thoughts on PlayStation Plus Game Catalog titles for January 2026? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about an alleged screenshot revealing the release date for Forza Horizon 6. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Can You Make Glass in Hytale? Hytale Windows, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Hytale is now available in early access, and, despite the similarities with Minecraft, there are some differences, including the process of making Windows and how to get Glass.

The Hypixel Studios title has plenty to discover, but for those who are used to playing Minecraft, it may be difficult to get those approaches out of their heads and learn the new mechanics.

This guide from Insider Gaming will make it easier, though, with a breakdown on Glass in Hytale and how to make Windows.

Can You Make Glass in Hytale?

Although you can create Glass objects in Hytale, you can’t create Glass blocks, or panes of Glass, like you can in Minecraft.

The Minecraft process of gathering Sand and burning it in a furnace will result in Glass Bottles being created. While these are useful for creating items like Health Potions, it won’t give you an item you can use to fill in holes in the side of your base to allow natural light to pass through.

So, while Glass is in Hytale, the whole process works completely differently from Minecraft, but it’s actually much simpler.

How to Make Windows in Hytale

Windows in Hytale are created by using Stone block or Wood blocks and interacting with the Builder’s Workbench, which shows all the items that the selected block can be turned into.

With a Stone or Wood block, you can select everything from windows to doors, stairs to trapdoors, without worrying about placement across a crafting grid. Instead, it’s just the one resource you need, which means you can finalize the design of your base much quicker than you can in Minecraft.

The type of Windows you can create depends on the type of Stone or Wood inputted, and there are some big differences. Marble Cobblestone, for example, provide Light Temple Windows, while Softwood Planks provide Crude Windows, so it’s best to gather a variety of different materials and choose the design you like best, particularly as not every Window design even has Glass as part of it.

Not every type of Stone block can be used for Windows, however, as normal Cobblestone, Basalt Cobblestone, and Volcanic Cobblestone are among those that don’t offer a design for Windows when selected in the Builder’s Workbench.

What is your favorite part of Hytale so far? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Hytale, check out all the new content that is planned to be added, find out how to find the Forgotten Temple, and take a look at the best mods to download.
